meanings.definition: Engaged in a petty quarrel or argument.
meanings.sent1: The squabbier siblings couldn't agree on which TV show to watch.
meanings.sent2: The children became squabbier as they fought over the last cookie.
meanings.sent3: The squabbier puppies playfully argued over a chew toy.
meanings.sent4: The squabbier birds chirped loudly in disagreement over the best nesting spot.
meanings.sent5: The squabbier neighbors bickered over whose turn it was to mow the lawn.

meanings.definition: Tending to argue or quarrel frequently.
meanings.sent1: The squabbier students often disrupted the class with their constant disagreements.
meanings.sent2: The squabbier team members struggled to work together on the project.
meanings.sent3: The squabbier friends jokingly argued about who was the better cook.
meanings.sent4: The squabbier clouds seemed to clash in the sky, creating a dramatic scene.
meanings.sent5: The squabbier colleagues couldn't reach a consensus during the meeting.
